title: Who was Robert Badinter, the most important Frenchman of whom you never heard?

quotes: Some of the French press covers on 10 February.
On Wednesday 14 February, the government held a ceremony of national homage Place Vendôme, Paris, where the Justice Ministry is located.
The son of Russian Jewish immigrants, Badinter was born on 30 March 1928 in Paris.

Following a doctorate in law in 1952, Badinter worked first as an attorney, then a professor, and finally in politics.

quotes: Even the conservative Le Figaro, a staunch opponent for most of his life, bowed to his ‘passion for justice’.
